Women's Health provides confidential information, examinations, and treatment, and information regarding all women's health issues. Board-certified gynecologists and nurse practitioners certified in women's health staff this unit. Additionally, many of our providers are certified to perform specialized testing if necessary, including colposcopies and biopsies and many are LGBTQ SafeZone trained.     Services available include*:   * Some services may incur a fee.     Complete well women visits including breast exam, gynecological exam, pap smears and other health maintenance testing as needed   Testing and treatment of sexually transmitted infections   Contraceptive counseling, management, and prescriptions (including IUD)   Evaluation of menstrual and other gynecologic disorders     Management and treatment of abnormal pap tests   HIV testing   Immunizations (HPV, Influenza, Tdap)   Pregnancy detection and options counseling     Preconception counseling and testing            Women's Health Workshop   Women's Health offers a general women's health workshop on a variety of topics including:     Contraceptive Options   Gynecological Exams   Sexually Transmitted Infection Prevention   Breast Self-Exam   And more     Workshops are 20 minutes in length and are available throughout the week by appointment. Call Women's Health Services at (212) 443-1166 to sign up. Same-day appointments are available for all women's health issues.                                  Staff Directory                  Learn about our Providers. Berkley Scholarship Program   Loan Programs   Teaching & Graduate Fellowships   Resources for Military Veterans   Resources for Social Enterprise   Tuition & Cost of Attendance     Admissions Request Information   Apply   Selection Criteria   Deadlines   Notification & Process   Application Instructions   Policies   Directors' Tips   FAQs     Meet With Us Visit Stern   Travel Directions   Events and Webinars   Videos   Day in the Life Student Videos   Podcasts   Virtual Tour   Contact a Student               Home / Programs & Admissions / Full-time MBA / Students / Women at Stern                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Women at Stern  At NYU Stern, you will have support for your goals from one of the strongest women's networks of all business schools     Meet Stern Women in Business                                      "Not only was Stern Women in Business (SWIB) an immediate network of women that I could turn to for advice and support ..." read more      "I chose to pursue my MBA at Stern for a few reasons, but the number one reason was the community. When I stepped onto campus ..." read more             SWIB  The student-run Stern Women in Business (SWIB) hosts career networking, professional development, community service and social events for Stern's female community. The annual SWIB conference draws more than 400 Stern students, alumnae and professionals from the New York City area.                 Getting Involved with SWIB      Leveraging the SWIB Network             Forté  Stern is a member of the Forté Foundation , a consortium of top business schools and companies dedicated to directing talented women toward leadership roles in business. Each June, Stern Forté Fellows participate in the annual Forté Conference. Each fall, Stern participates in Forté Forums across the U.S.    Forté is now accepting participant applications for 2015 Forté MBALaunch for Women , which is designed to help women prepare top-notch MBA applications. This program is intended for women applying to MBA programs in Fall 2015 and targeting enrollment in Fall 2016. It is designed to provide guidance, resources and ongoing feedback over a 10-month period (January – October 2015). Participants in the 2015 program must apply by November 16, 2014.    Women Faculty  Representing 20% of the Stern faculty , female professors play a critical role in the School's success and teach some of the most popular, well-respected classes. Here are just a few:      Jennifer N. Carpenter , Associate Professor of Finance    Jill Kickul , Clinical Professor in the Business & Society Program Area    Sonia Marciano , Clinical Full Professor of Management & Organizations    Priya Raghubir , Professor of Marketing                                                    Take Action     Sign Up for Information   Meet With Us   Apply                                               Events      Opening Doors for Women   Each year, NYU Stern hosts Opening Doors for Women, our annual marquee women's admissions event. Opening Doors 2015 will be held in the fall. Check back for updates.
